bug.short_desc: Can't backup or restore XFS filesystems
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
I swear that there was a bug open on this somewhere, but I can't find it now. Maybe it was against RHEL instead.
In any case, amanda as compiled in Fedora doesn't have the ability to backup or restore XFS filesystems. XFS is the default filesystem for Fedora Server installations, so it's kind of an odd situation. But if it is built without xfsdump available then it will be compiled in such a way that xfsdump simply cannot be used. It's sufficient to add a simple BuildRequires: xfsdump. This doesn't introduce any runtime dependency on xfsdump so this should be quite safe to do.
I would also suggest that the -client package grow soft dependencies on dump and xfsdump. At least Suggests:. Currently the only backup utility that's actually required is tar.
As always, I'm happy to provide a patch or just commit changes for you if you like.
Thanks for your report. I have found previous bugzilla, that you have mentioned (#1140321), so I will add BuildRequires for dump and xfsdump.

Thanks; I've requested access. I'm actually a pkgdb admin (and an scm admin) so sometimes when I request access it doesn't consult the package owners and instead just gives me access. Thus I always find it better to ask first.
In case it matters, I have a long history with Amanda, having used it since the early 90s. First with QIC tapes and then the luxurious DDS-1 drive we had. (Over 1GB per tape!) Currently run a Fedora server and a bunch of CentOS and Fedora clients to a 24-tape LTO6 library (soon to add a 48-tape LTO6 library to that).
